intro: Spergula rubra subsp. atheniensis, commonly known as the Athens red grass, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its slender, reddish stems and small, pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. It produces small, oval-shaped seeds that are dispersed by wind. This subspecies is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and scrublands.
